pullRequest.title: Azure External Dependencies BOM
pullRequest.bodyText:
Fixes #10342
This PR aims to include the external dependencies that the Azure SDKs for Java use in a BOM for customer consumption.
Proposals
Include external dependencies in azure-sdk-bom.
Including all external dependencies for the Azure client libraries in azure-sdk-bom will silo these dependencies based on the library type (client, data, management). This will create a very targeted scope which will allow for easier handling of the dependencies. This has the downside where these external dependencies are now tied to a specific track.
Create another BOM for external dependencies.
Creating a separate BOM separates the shipping and external dependencies. This would allow for consumers to use this separately from their Azure SDK dependencies. This has the downside when using multiple BOMs they need to be validated as compatible.
Current State of the PR
Currently, the PR is representing the former option where external dependencies are being included in the azure-sdk-bom. Doing this allows consumers of the SDKs to both use compatible Azure Java SDKs and set their dependencies to match the versions the SDKs will be using. The aim for this is to reduce dependency conflicts consumers of the SDKs see.
To see the other option with having another BOM for external dependencies please view previous commits.

nodes.bodyText: looking at prior art on maven, I think we can change this to "azure-core-dependencies" and drop the 'external' and 'bom'

commit.message: Renamed module, removed invalid dependency, commented out dependency that breaks dependency checker
Add all external compile time dependencies to azure-sdk-bom

nodes.bodyText: Should the name be updated to azure-core-dependencies-bom?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,51 @@
+# Azure external dependencies BOM for libraries and services
+The Azure external dependencies BOM for libraries provides all shared artifacts that are used in Java development for
+Azure. It provides a simple and elegant way to manage dependencies for multiple Azure libraries and services.
+
+## Table of contents
+- [Getting started](#getting-started)
+  - [Adding the BOM to your project](#adding-the-bom-to-your-project)
+  - [Adding libraries to your project](#adding-libraries-to-your-project)
+
+## Getting started
+
+### Adding the BOM to your project
+
+To consume the BOM include it in the `dependencyManagement` section of your project's POM. Note that this **does not**
+result in all dependencies being included in your project.
+
+```xml
+<dependencyManagement>
+  <dependencies>
+    <dependency>
+      <groupId>com.azure</groupId>
+      <artifactId>azure-external-dependencies-bom</artifactId>

nodes.bodyText: Should this be core-dependencies or external-dependencies? I think core can be confusing as it seems like it's related to azure-core artifact.
Should we have all spring boot dependencies in this bom or is it better to keep this bom for only maintaining external dependencies used in client libraries?

commit.message: Remove azure-core-dependencies BOM, updated external dependencies to match versions
Fix a few versions, disable build failing on version conflicts
Merged in master, updated README to discuss inclusion of library dependencies
Update to versions released in June
Update BOM versions based on final June releases

nodes.bodyText: "After adding the BOM, Azure..." there should be a comma after the prepositional phrase.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -30,8 +32,8 @@ result in all dependencies being included in your project.
 
 ### Adding libraries to your project
 
-After adding the BOM all artifacts included in the BOM are now available to be added as a dependency without listing the
-artifact's version.
+After adding the BOM Azure client libraries included in the BOM are now available to be added as a dependency without

nodes.bodyText: Why is this being commented out? If it needs to be removed then it should be removed entirely.
Now that we have combined Azure client libraries and external dependencies into a single bom, this is no longer required.
nit: it would be nice to have these dependencies listed in sorted order (separate external and azure sorted lists).

commit.message:
Update pom.xml

Remove commented out configuration.
